senses.sense_definition: A hard, shiny, solid material, such as iron, gold, or copper, that conducts heat and electricity and can be shaped.

examples.text: Gold is a very valuable <w>metal</w> used in jewelry.
They recycle scrap <w>metal</w> to help the environment.
The gate was made of heavy black <w>metal</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A genre of rock music characterized by loud, distorted guitars, strong rhythms, and often aggressive vocals.

examples.text: My brother plays the drums in a heavy <w>metal</w> band.
She prefers listening to <w>metal</w> rather than pop music.

senses.sense_definition: Crushed stone or rock used to build or repair roads.

examples.text: The truck dumped a load of <w>metal</w> to fill the potholes in the driveway.
Workers laid fresh <w>metal</w> on the country road.

senses.sense_definition: Any chemical element heavier than hydrogen and helium.

examples.text: Astronomers study the abundance of <w>metals</w> in distant stars.
The presence of <w>metals</w> affects the color and lifespan of a star.

senses.sense_definition: Extremely tough, intense, cool, or aggressive, resembling the culture of heavy metal music.

examples.text: Wearing a suit of armor to the grocery store is so <w>metal</w>.
That action movie was absolutely <w>metal</w> from start to finish.

senses.sense_definition: To make or repair a road using crushed rock or stone.

examples.text: The council decided to <w>metal</w> the dirt track to improve access.
They have <w>metalled</w> the road surface to withstand heavy traffic.
